verbs.description: nomadize (third-person singular simple present nomadizes, present participle nomadizing, simple past and past participle nomadized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To lead the life of a nomad; to wander with flocks and herds for the sake of finding pasturage.
examples: The Vogules nomadize chiefly about the Rivers Irtish, Obi, Kama, and Volga.
